misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that a primitive variable like 'a' acts as a live link or Excel-like reference to an array element (scores[j]). Consequently, they believe that if they modify 'scores[j]' later in the code, the value of 'a' will automatically update to the new value.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: In Java, assigning a primitive value (like an int from an array) to a variable creates an independent copy of that value at that specific point in time. The variable 'a' does not maintain a connection to the array index 'scores[j]'.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: The student writes redundant code, creating a second temporary variable ('tempScore') to capture the value of 'scores[j]' because they do not trust that the variable 'a' (which already holds that value) will remain stable during the swap process.
